task.title: Create a Personal Access Token in GitHub
task.shortdesc: This task will show you how to create a personal access token for your repository in GitHub.

taskbody.prereq: You must have created a repository in GitHub.

context.p: Here you will learn how to create a personal access token in GitHub which is another essential part of the process.

step.cmd: Click on your profile picture in the top right corner

fig.title: Screen capture of where to find your GitHub profile

image.alt: Screen capture of the home page for the GitHub repository, with a red circle circling the profile photo in the top right corner.

step.cmd: Click “Settings” in the drop down menu
Click “Developer Settings” in the left menu

fig.title: Screen capture of where to find your developer settings

image.alt: Screen capture of where to find your developer settings in GitHub, with a red circle around the developer settings button located on the left-hand side of the page.

substep.cmd: Click “Personal access tokens” in the left menu, then select either “Fine-grained tokens” or “Tokens (classic)”

fig.title: Screen capture of where to find your personal access token in developer settings

image.alt: Screen capture of where to find your personal access token in developer settings. Located on left side of page and circled in red.

fig.title: Screen capture showing where to generate your personal access token

image.alt: Screen capture showing where to generate your personal access token, doing so by circling in red "Generate new token" button in center of page.

substep.cmd: Add a note for what this token is for
Select an expiration date (whatever you feel is appropriate is fine)
Select scopes for your personal access token if desired

fig.title: Screen capture showing what to fill out when creating a new personal access token

image.alt: Screen capture showing what to fill out when creating a new personal access token, including adding a note, setting an expiration date for it, and selecting any scopes if necessary.

substep.cmd: Scroll to the bottom of the page and click “Generate token”

step.cmd: Ensure GITHUB_TOKEN has permission to push to the gh-pages branch

fig.title: Screen capture showing where to find your repository settings

image.alt: Screen capture showing where to find your repository settings, which are located on the menu bar in the middle top of the page.

fig.title: Screen capture showing where to find the "general" settings under "actions"

image.alt: Screen capture showing where to find the "general" settings under "actions", which is located on the left-hand side on the menu bar in settings.

fig.title: Screen capture showing where to find the read and write permissions under workflow permissions

image.alt: Screen capture showing where to find the read and write permissions under workflow permissions. It is the first option under workflow permissions and is circled in red.

info.p: You now have a personal access token for your repository in GitHub!
